description: Former Green Bay Packers cornerback Sam Shields wants to return to the NFL. Shields, an undrafted free agent who signed in 2010, suffered his fifth documented concussion in the season opener...
title: Former Packers cornerback Sam Shields feels 'normal,' eyes comeback, paper reports
title_page: Former Packers cornerback Sam Shields feels 'normal,' eyes comeback, paper reports
maintext:
Former Green Bay Packers cornerback Sam Shields wants to return to the NFL.
Shields, an undrafted free agent who signed in 2010, suffered his fifth documented concussion in the season opener in 2016. He was released after missing the rest of the season and hasn’t played since.
He has been working out in Sarasota, Florida and said he feels “normal” after battling on-going symptoms of repeated concussions and said he’s ready to make a comeback to football.
“You’re going to see the (number) 37 you remembered,” Shields, 30, told the Milwaukee Journal Sentinel . “Everything you seen in Green Bay, you’re going to see that wherever I’m at.”
He said he would love to return to the Packers. If not, he’s confident some NFL team will give him a shot.
“Oh, yeah, most definitely, man,” Shields said. “I think they will because I can still run. I’ve still got that in me. I think somebody will want that.”
